text: The Branch’s Righteous Reign
And a shoot will come out from the stump of Jesse,
and a branch from its roots will bear fruit.
And the spirit of Yahweh shall rest on him—
a spirit of wisdom and understanding,
a spirit of counsel and might,
a spirit of knowledge and the fear of Yahweh.

And his ⸤breath⸥\f + \fr 11:3 \ft Hebrew “smelling,” perhaps metaphorically as “delight” as in \xt Amos 5:14; \ft perhaps this line was accidentally copied twice from the preceding line \f* \add is\add* in the fear of Yahweh.
And he shall judge not by his eyesight,
and he shall rebuke not by ⸤what he hears with⸥\f + \fr 11:3 \ft Literally “the rumors of” \f* his ears.
But he shall judge \add the\add* poor with righteousness,
and he shall decide for \add the\add* needy of \add the\add* earth with rectitude.
And he shall strike \add the\add* earth with the rod of his mouth,
and he shall kill \add the\add* wicked person with the breath of his lips.
And righteousness shall be the belt around his waist,
and faithfulness the belt around his loins.
And a wolf shall ⸤stay⸥\f + \fr 11:6 \ft Literally “dwell as an alien” \f* with a lamb,
and a leopard shall lie down with a kid,
and a calf and a lion and a fatling together
⸤as a small boy leads⸥\f + \fr 11:6 \ft Literally “and a small boy leading” \f* them.
And a cow and a bear shall graze;
their young shall lie down together.
And a lion shall eat straw like the cattle.
And ⸤an infant⸥\f + \fr 11:8 \ft Literally “one nursing” \f* shall play over a serpent’s hole,
and ⸤a toddler⸥\f + \fr 11:8 \ft Literally “one who is weaned” \f* shall put his hand on a viper’s hole.
They will not injure and they will not destroy on all of my ⸤holy mountain⸥,\f + \fr 11:9 \ft Literally “mountain of holiness” \f*
for the earth will be full \add of the\add* knowledge \add of\add* Yahweh,
as the waters cover the sea.
And this shall happen on that day:
\add the\add* nations shall inquire of the root of Jesse,
which shall be standing as a signal to \add the\add* peoples,
and his resting place shall be glorious.
The Regathered Remnant
And this shall happen on that day:
The Lord will again \add extend\add* his hand a second \add time\add*
to acquire the remnant of his people that is left,
from Assyria, Egypt, Pathros, Cush, Elam, Shinar, Hamath, and the coastlands of the sea,
and he will raise a signal for the nations.
And he will gather the outcasts of Israel,
and he will gather the scattered ones of Judah together from the four ⸤corners⸥\f + \fr 11:12 \ft Literally “wings” \f* of the earth.
And the jealousy of Ephraim shall depart,
and the enemies of Judah shall be cut off.
Ephraim shall not be jealous \add of\add* Judah,
and Judah shall not be an enemy \add of\add* Ephraim.

But they shall ⸤swoop⸥\f + \fr 11:14 \ft Literally “fly” \f* upon \add the\add* Philistine shoulder,\f + \fr 11:14 \ft That is, the hill country west of Judah \f* ⸤westward⸥.\f + \fr 11:14 \ft Literally “sea” \f*
Together they shall plunder \add the\add* sons of \add the\add* east.
Edom and Moab ⸤will be under their command⸥,\f + \fr 11:14 \ft Literally “the stretching of their hand” \f*
and the sons of Ammon \add will be\add* their subjugated people.
And Yahweh will divide\f + \fr 11:15 \ft Or “utterly destroy” \f* the tongue\f + \fr 11:15 \ft Probably the “gulf” \f* of the sea of Egypt,\f + \fr 11:15 \ft That is, the Red Sea \f*
and he will wave his hand over the river\f + \fr 11:15 \ft That is, the Euphrates River \f* with his scorching wind;
and he will strike it into seven streams,
and he will ⸤make it passable by foot⸥.\f + \fr 11:15 \ft Literally “cause to walk with the sandal” \f*
So there shall be a highway from Assyria for the remnant of his people that remains,
as there was for Israel ⸤when⸥\f + \fr 11:16 \ft Literally “in \fq the \ft day” \f* it went up from the land of Egypt.
